column4: As you can see in my paste, VLC and all the other ones ARE there.
Firefox just doesnt use them properly
So, basically, what can i do to make it easier for you to help me?
I KNOW those plugins can play it and i KNOW because i tried them externally AND because they show up in ABOUT:PLUGINS but they just dont work!
which plugin is firefox actually loading to play the video that fails?
That's what i am trying to find out.
right click on it, all of the plugins ahve their own unique menu
I think firefox itself outputs the NO VIDEO message because when i deleted everything except VLC in the plugins folder, it still said no video.
no, when you play a video
http://www.linspire.com/products_linspire_whatis.php?tab=compatibility  do the embedded videos work on this page?
scroll down
get rid of vlc.  Does totem work?
No, i want to keep it. I installed it because i had this problem the first time i tried playing a video.
we are troubleshooting
both work
they should.
do what I said
I really have the feeling something DID explode in your face today...
or get rid of totem and troubleshoot vlc.  Either way, we don't even know what plugin you are using
show us a screenshot of what firefox does on one of the linspire videos
/etc/apache2/apache2.conf  if you are using apach2
